Our holy…house…burned up. This expression refers to the destruction of the temple in Jerusalem in 587 b.c. The loss of the temple meant the loss of Israel's ability to practice her religion. It meant the loss or postponement of the covenant and its promises.

where our fathers praised thee. The ancestors of Israel in Isaiah's time praised the Lord in their temple, until it was destroyed by enemies.

all our pleasant things are laid waste. One translation is "All that we treasured lies in ruins" (NIV), perhaps referring to the sacred vessels and other accoutrements of the temple, or possibly the temple itself. Other translations read, "All our pleasant places have become ruins" (RSV); and "All the things of beauty are destroyed" (LB).
